attributes.action: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to instigate an early review of why the access path in Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote, Gloucestershire has not been opened and seek an immediate safety review into the dangers of keeping it closed.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Crest Nicholson, a national builder is in the final stages of a development in Woodmancote, near Cheltenham. Sadly there has been tensions between some local residents, Crest Nicholson, their architects and Tewkesbury Council. 

There is a group trying to block this path being opened due to it being “a perceived eyesore” and having some safety concerns. The development has been built sympathetically using Cotswold stone. 

There is an issue on the site around parking and access at times although this should not stop this path being opened. Planning permission was granted and the safety of this crossing has been passed by the relevant safety bodies. 

This path removes the need to use a dirt path leading to Butts Lane or walking along the main road (which has high traffic levels and is a major source of concern for most locals due to the speed of traffic). The path is to the playing fields and the Village hall (where pre-school, Probus, ballet and many clubs meet). This path allows for a safer and shorter passage and will reduce the chances of an accident.(or we could drive this journey)

We need an urgent saftey review into the danger of keeping this closed

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
